sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Mechanical Sieve Shaker for particle size analysis and classification of pharmaceutical powders and granules using standard sieves.
sections.scope: Applicable to sieve analysis activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the sieve shaker is placed on a stable, level surface.
Verify that the clamp mechanism and mounting platform are functional.
Select appropriate sieves based on particle size range to be analyzed.
Clean and dry all sieves thoroughly before use.
Arrange sieves in descending order of mesh size (largest opening on top).
Place collection pan at the bottom and lid on top of the sieve stack.
Weigh the sample accurately (typically 25-100 g depending on material).
Place the sample on the top sieve.
Secure the sieve stack on the shaker mounting platform.
Tighten the clamp to hold sieves firmly.
Set the shaking time (typically 5-20 minutes).
Set amplitude and frequency if adjustable.
Start the mechanical shaker.
Allow sieving to continue for the set duration without interruption.
After completion, stop the shaker and allow it to come to rest.
Carefully remove the sieve stack from the shaker.
Disassemble the sieve stack starting from top.
Collect and weigh material retained on each sieve.
Weigh material collected in the bottom pan.
Calculate percent retained on each sieve and cumulative percent.
Clean all sieves thoroughly using brush and compressed air.
Inspect sieves for damage or mesh deformation.
Document all weight data, calculations, and observations in the analytical record.
precautions: Use appropriate sample size to prevent sieve overloading.
Do not force material through sieves manually.
Handle sieves carefully to avoid mesh damage.
Ensure sieves are properly stacked and clamped.
Use consistent sieving time for reproducible results.
Clean sieves thoroughly between different samples.
Inspect sieve integrity regularly and replace if damaged.
Use calibrated sieves with valid certification.
Wear appropriate PPE including mask and gloves.
Perform analysis in controlled environment to minimize moisture effects.
